channel.title: POLITICO Pulse
channel.description: Delivered daily by 10 a.m., Pulse examines the latest news in health care politics and policy.

item.title: ‘Resetting’ the GOP health care vision
item.description: President Donald Trump released his health care affordability plan Thursday — a sweeping blueprint pressuring Congress to cement many of his executive actions into law.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: SAMHSA grants reinstated
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services has reinstated nearly 3,000 substance use disorder and mental health services grants worth nearly $2 billion a day after terminating them.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: A divided Senate wades back into the abortion wars
item.description: The Senate HELP Committee is expected to meet this morning to debate federal regulation of abortion pills — the predominant method of ending pregnancies nationwide and a key way patients are circumventing state bans.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Congress to reject Trump global health cuts
item.description: Trump put foreign-aid cuts at the top of his agenda when he took office.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: RFK Jr.’s fountain-of-youth moonshot
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is backing research into the lymphatic system and psychedelic drugs to reverse aging.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: The GOP Obamacare defectors
item.description: Seventeen GOP lawmakers rebuffed opposition from House leadership Thursday and voted to extend enhanced Obamacare subsidies for three years.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: House tees up Obamacare subsidy vote
item.description: The House is expected to pass a bill today extending enhanced Obamacare subsidies that expired at the end of 2025, which sent Affordable Care Act premiums skyrocketing.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Thune’s 3 key ingredients for a health care deal
item.description: Congress is back to trying to solve its health care problem.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The Obamacare fight is back in the spotlight
item.description: House Democrats could move as soon as tomorrow to force a vote on extending the expired Obamacare subsidies for three years.
item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu, Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Amanda Chu, Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: What our health reporters are watching in 2026
item.description: The past year has shifted the health care landscape in dozens of ways.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Sickle cell cures, Medicaid barriers
item.description: The federal government wants to make it easier for Medicaid patients to access new, curative treatments — one of the few initiatives on which President Donald Trump and the public health establishment are aligned.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Can the US vaccinate like Denmark?
item.description: President Donald Trump and HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. like the way that wealthy European countries vaccinate their children against fewer diseases compared with U.S. kids.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Dems’ unity hits a Medicare-for-All wall
item.description: Some more moderate Democrats worry that progressives’ renewed push for Medicare for All would undermine the party’s recent united front in fighting for an extension of the Obamacare subsidies set to expire at the end of the year.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: GOP, HHS move to end gender-affirming care for kids
item.description: Republicans in Congress and the Trump administration are reframing health care as a culture-war issue that they’ve relied on before: restricting transgender care for children.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Let the ACA finger-pointing games begin
item.description: Now that it’s clear Congress is at an impasse over what to do about spiking health care costs, interest groups on the left and right have a new goal: convincing voters the other side is to blame.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Health insurers’ wish list appears doomed
item.description: Health insurers continue to push lawmakers for a clean extension of enhanced Obamacare subsidies — emphasizing that changing the tax credits' structure when open enrollment is well underway, and with subsidies set to expire at year’s end, is unrealistic.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: White House reluctant to weigh in on health care
item.description: The White House is contemplating the risks of getting involved in the health care fight playing out on Capitol Hill.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Health care week in the House
item.description: House Republican leaders have a plan to curb rising health care costs — and it doesn’t include an extension of the expiring enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Eyes turn to the House for a health care solution
item.description: Two dueling proposals to ease rising health care costs failed to pass out of the Senate on Thursday. Now, the House is under even more pressure to find a fix.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The health care affordability wars
item.description: The Senate will vote on competing health care bills today, and both Democrats and Republicans claim their plans are the more affordable option for tens of millions of enrollees.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Thursday’s health vote: GOP factions to watch
item.description: Senate Republicans are finally set to vote on a GOP health care plan Thursday — the same day that the Senate will vote on Democrats' proposal to extend the enhanced Affordable Care Act subsidies by three years.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Trump leaves GOP guessing on health policy
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: States battle for rural health funding
item.description: States are pledging to enact White House-favored policies for a chance to win bigger shares of a $50 billion rural health fund that Congress and President Donald Trump created in July.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Health insurers appeal to Republicans
item.description: The leading health insurance trade group is trying out new messaging in its push to get Republicans on board with extending the enhanced Obamacare subsidies that are set to expire at year’s end.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: More ACIP confusion ahead
item.description: The CDC’s panel of outside vaccine advisers is kicking off a two-day meeting today that could result in the biggest shakeup to the childhood immunization schedule yet under Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s leadership.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: Some GOP members don't fear ACA blowback
item.description: Obamacare premiums are set to spike when enhanced pandemic-era subsidies expire at the end of the year. Many Congressional Republicans don’t expect to see political backlash.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Weighing the cost of GLP-1s coverage
item.description: For state Medicaid programs, choosing whether or not to cover weight-loss medications is not a simple decision.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: RFK Jr.’s vaccine injury overhaul
item.description: Health Secretary Robert K. Kennedy Jr. is considering dramatic changes to the federal program for people injured by vaccines
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Trump team boasts $12B Medicare drug savings
item.description: The Trump administration is touting $12 billion in federal savings in Medicare’s second year of drug price negotiations.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Trump health plan raises key questions
item.description: President Donald Trump was set to release his new health care plan on Monday afternoon, but the White House delayed the unveiling amid GOP pushback to the proposal.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
